function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of real-time IAQ monitoring can lead to delayed detection of unhealthy indoor air conditions, increasing the risk of exposure to contaminants.","Impact":"Increased likelihood of health issues and reduced quality of life for individuals in both urban and rural areas.","Mitigation":"Developing an IAQ monitoring system that operates in real-time and can provide instant alerts and guidance for preventive measures.","Technologies":"Real-time sensors, AI prediction systems, mobile app-based monitoring, instant alert systems.","People":"Individuals in urban and rural areas, especially those in high-risk environments (e.g., industrial areas, agricultural areas).","Owner":"Researchers, technology developers, government health agencies."},{"Description":"Inefficient IAQ monitoring systems may result in prolonged exposure to poor indoor air quality, especially in rural areas where specific requirements may be overlooked.","Impact":"Increased health risks for individuals in rural areas due to prolonged exposure to contaminants and pollutants.","Mitigation":"Designing cost-effective and robust IAQ monitoring systems tailored for rural areas, incorporating specific requirements and considering severe monitoring conditions.","Technologies":"Power-efficient monitoring systems, robust sensor networks, mobile app-based monitoring, real-time alert systems.","People":"Residents in rural areas, especially those in resource-limited or underprivileged communities.","Owner":"Researchers, public health organizations, policymakers."},{"Description":"Lack of awareness and access to IAQ monitoring systems for non-tech savvy individuals can hinder the adoption of preventive measures and lead to prolonged exposure to unhealthy indoor air.","Impact":"Limited ability for non-tech savvy individuals to take preventive actions in response to poor IAQ, increasing the risk of health issues and discomfort.","Mitigation":"Developing mobile app-based monitoring systems that are user-friendly and easy to operate, providing simple and clear guidance for preventive measures.","Technologies":"User-friendly mobile applications, intuitive interfaces, accessible sensor networks.","People":"Non-tech savvy individuals, particularly in rural areas and older populations.","Owner":"Technology developers, community organizations, educational institutions."}]}
